intro: Orbea lepida, commonly known as the silver moonviolet, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its striking, pale violet flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has a succulent, trailing growth habit with fleshy, dark green leaves that are covered in a fine, silvery pubescence. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light to flourish. Orbea lepida is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ease of care.
